definition: to be unable to move a single step
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: This fear confined me to a narrow comfort zone.
sentences.chinese: 恐惧心理把我局限在狭窄的安乐窝里动弹不得。

sentences.english: I got stuck in the elevator for twenty minutes.
sentences.chinese: 我因电梯故障二十分钟而动弹不得。

sentences.english: A wrestling hold in which the opponent's arm is held so that it cannot be moved.
sentences.chinese: 摔跤擒拿法，抓紧对手的手臂令其动弹不得。

sentences.english: We are stuck in the city traffic.
sentences.chinese: 我们在市区里动弹不得。

sentences.english: The bus was so crowded that nobody could move.
She was trussed up with yellow nylon rope.
sentences.chinese: 她被人用黄尼龙绳子捆得动弹不得。

sentences.english: Its legs were stuck in the soft earth and it could not move.
sentences.chinese: 它的腿陷入了软土里，动弹不得。

sentences.english: We were boxed up all night in a railway carriage.
sentences.chinese: 一整夜我们都挤在火车车箱里动弹不得。

sentences.english: His one leg was up in the air and he could not move.
sentences.chinese: 他的一条腿悬在空中，使他动弹不得。

sentences.english: I always get stuck in rush hour traffic .
sentences.chinese: 我总是卡在尖峰时间的车阵里，动弹不得。

sentences.english: He was trapped in the crashed car and couldn't move his legs.
sentences.chinese: 他被困在撞坏的汽车里，两腿动弹不得。

sentences.english: I always get stuck in rush hour traffic.
sentences.chinese: 我总是卡在尖峰年华的车阵里，动弹不得。

sentences.english: He put me back on the wall, let me move.
sentences.chinese: 他把我死死的按在墙上，让我动弹不得。

sentences.english: Old Tang's feet were stuck in the prison fence.
sentences.chinese: 老唐的脚卡在了监狱栅栏上，动弹不得。

sentences.english: I was too frightened to move, but two big girls pushed me towards him.
sentences.chinese: 我害怕得动弹不得，但两个大女孩把我推了过去。

definition: see 寸步難行|寸步难行[cun4 bu4 nan2 xing2]
to not move a single jot (idiom)
to jam/to choke/to clutch/also pr. [qia3 zhu4]
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
